result.execSummary:
The defendant Thomas J Haessly was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. On one or more other charges, Thomas J Haessly was found not guilty. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Thomas J Haessly is presumed innocent of the not guilty charges.

  • Thomas J Haessly was found guilty of OWI (5th or 6th), a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).
  • Thomas J Haessly was found guilty of Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).
  • Thomas J Haessly was found guilty of Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).
  • Thomas J Haessly was found guilty of Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).
  • Thomas J Haessly was found guilty of Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).
  • Thomas J Haessly was found guilty of Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: Fine to be paid as a condition of extended supervision

Costs to be paid as a condition of extended supervision

Reimbursement for Blood Draw costs to be paid/forwarded to Waukesha Co Clerk of Courts for the Waukesha County Sheriff's Department

Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department. 

If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.

AODA assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended

Absolute sobriety, random UA's

No use or possession of alcohol or illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia

No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription

Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed

Inform agent of all prescriptions

Follow through with any assessments, evaluations, treatment and/or counseling recommended by agent

No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged or distributed

Defendant to have no contact with Menards

records.addlTxt:
Case called at 2:36 p.m.
Attorney Abbey Nickolie in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Attorney Cassandra A Miller Ms. in court for Thomas J Haessly.  
Defendant Thomas J Haessly in court, in custody.  
State makes sentencing recommendations.
Defense makes sentencing recommendations.
Defendant makes statements.

COUNT 1
Total Prison:  7 YEARS
Initial Confinement:  2 YEARS
Extended Supervision:  5 YEARS
262-Days Credit.

Defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant is not eligible for the Substance Abuse Program. 

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:  
AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
Absolute Sobriety;  Random U.A.'s ; 
No Use or Possession of alcohol or illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia;
No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed;
Inform Agent of all prescriptions;
Follow through with any assessments, evaluations, treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent; 
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged, or distributed;
Defendant is to have no contact with Menards
  
D/L REVOCATION: 3 Years.
IGNITION INTERLOCK: 3 Years.

FINE: $1,569.00 (includes ignition interlock) 
DNA SAMPLE AND SURCHARGE:  $250.00
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
BLOOD DRAW FEE:  $35.00 paid through Waukesha County Circuit Court to be forward to Waukesha County Sheriff's Department or to be converted to a civil judgment for non payment of fee.

Other:  AODA ASSESSMENT AND FOLLOW THROUGH.
Felony warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.  

COUNT 3
Court orders the following:
6 Months Jail
Sentence is to run Concurrent with Cts. 1, 4, 5, 6, and 7.

COSTS:  $243.00 (Waived by the Court)
DNA SAMPLE AND SURCHARGE:  $200.00 (Waived by the Court) 
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.

Sentence is to run Concurrent with Cts. 1, 3, 5, 6, and 7.

Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.

records.addlTxt: Stipulation signed by the parties and filed in Court

Case(s) called at 8:31 AM for Jury Trial
Attorney Abbey Nickolie and Christian Farina in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Attorney Cassandra A Miller Ms. in court for Thomas J Haessly. 
Defendant Thomas J Haessly in court, in custody. 
State moves to dismiss Count 2 of the Information.  Court grants.
State files an Amended Information (7 counts).
Court addresses Motion in Limine with the Attorneys.
Court calls for the jurors at 9:12 a.m. Jurors enter the courtroom at 9:35 a.m.
Court introduces his staff to the Jurors.  Clerk gives the jurors the oath for voir dire.
Court conducts voir dire.  Court takes a recess at 10:33 a.m.  Jurors excused.
Court reconvenes at 10:45 a.m.  Court continues with voir dire.
Counsel exercise strikes.  Court announces names of the 12 jurors to hear the case.
Court takes a recess at 11:12 a.m.  Court reconvenes at 11:22 p.m.
Same appearances.  Jurors enter the courtroom.  Clerk swears the jurors to try the issues.
Court reads the preliminary instructions to the jury.
State presents opening statements.  Defense presents opening statements.
Court breaks for lunch at 11:55 p.m.

Court reconvenes at 1:12 P.M.
Court Reporter for the p.m. is Deidre Thies.
Same appearances  Jurors enter the courtroom at 1:16 p.m.
State calls Joshua Pluta sworn and testified.  Direct-examination by the State.
State's exhibits 1 and 2 marked, offered, and received.
Cross-examination by the Defense.
Court takes a recess at 1:50 p.m.  Court reconvenes at 2:01 p.m.
Jurors enter the courtroom.  State calls Deputy Samuel Yanke sworn and testified.
Direct-examination by the State.  Exhibit 3 marked, offered, and received,
Cross-examination by the Defense.  Re-direct by the State.  
Re-cross by the Defense.  State calls Jonathan Tomko sworn and testified.
Direct-examination by the State.  State's exhibit 4 marked, offered, and received.
State's exhibit 5 marked, offered, and received.  State's exhibit 6 marked, offered, and received.
Cross-examination by the Defense.  Court takes a recess at 3:35 p.m.
Court reconvenes at 3:48 p.m.  State calls Deputy Samantha Gustafson sworn and testified.
Cross-examination by the Defense.  Court reads the stipulation into the record.
State rests.  Jurors are excused at 4:00 p.m.  Court reconvenes at 4:12 p.m.
Jurors enter the courtroom.  Defense recalls Jonathan Tomko.  Court reconvenes at 4:20 p.m.
Same appearances.  Jurors enter the courtroom.
Defense calls Thomas J. Haessly sworn and testified.
Direct examination by the Defense.  Exhibit 7 marked, offered, and received.
Cross-examination by the State.  Juror's are excused at 5:11 p.m.
Court discusses Jury Instructions with the Attorneys.  Court reconvenes at 6:02 p.m.
Same appearances.  Jurors enter the courtroom.  Court reads the Jury Instructions.
State presents closing arguments.  Defense presents closing arguments.
State presents rebuttal closing arguments.
Court gives the final instructions.  Clerk swears in the bailiff in charge of the jurors.
Jurors go to deliberate at 6:59 p.m.  Jurors had questions at 8:15 p.m.
Court goes on the record at 8:17 p.m..  Same appearances.  Court gives a written response to the jury
regarding questions 1 and 2.  Court plays the 911 call.
Verdict reached at 9:27 p.m.  Court reconvenes.  Same appearance.
Jurors enter the courtroom at 9:33 p.m.  Clerk reads the verdicts.
Counts 1, 3, 4, 5, 6, and 7 Guilty.  Count 2 Not Guilty.
Court polls the jurors. Jurors are excused at 9:39 p.m.
State makes a motion for Judgment on the Verdicts for Counts 1, 3, 4, 5, 6, and 7.
Court grants.
Sentencing hearing scheduled for October 14, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Sentencing hearing on October 14, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

Abbey Nickolie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Thomas J Haessly in court, in custody, with attorney Cassandra A Miller.  
State calls Deputy Samuel Yanke sworn and testified.
Direct-examination by the State.
Cross-examination by the Defense.
Re-Direct by the State.  State rests.
Closing arguments made by Attorney Miller.
Closing arguments made by Attorney Nickolie.
Court DENIES the Motion.
Defense requests that the Cash Bail be LOWERED.  
Defense requests Huber Bailee Status if the Court will not lower the cash bail.
State opposes a bail modification.
Court DENIES the Motion.
Next court dates remain as previously set.

11:18 AM Defendant Thomas J Haessly in court with attorney Cassandra A Miller.  Abbey Nickolie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Waukesha County, Deputy, Samuel Yanke sworn and testified on direct by Atty. Nickolie.  Cross examiantion by Atty. Miller.  Parties are stipulating to the 4 owis.  State rests. Testimony closed.  Atty. Nickolie moves for bind over.  Atty. Miller objects to bind over.    Court finds probable cause to believe that a felony was committed and binds the defendant over for trial.  Waive reading of Information.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Bail remains as fixed.  Hearing scheduled for March 21, 2022 at 09:00 am.
